results.title: Incidence and risk factors of postpericardiotomy syndrome requiring medical attention: The Finland postpericardiotomy syndrome study.
results.text_hl: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Postpericardiotomy_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011185 @@@postpericardiotomy syndrome@@@ more often had 1 or more red blood cell units transfused (61% vs 43%, P = .008) after surgery and less often had @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes@@@ (12% vs 31% P = .002) or @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ medication (3.3% vs 20%, P = .001) compared with those without @<m>DISEASE_Postpericardiotomy_Syndrome</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D011185 @@@postpericardiotomy syndrome@@@.

citations.NLM: Lehto J, Gunn J, Karjalainen P, Airaksinen J, Kiviniemi T. Incidence and risk factors of postpericardiotomy syndrome requiring medical attention: The Finland postpericardiotomy syndrome study. J Thorac Cardiovasc Surg. 2015 May;149(5):1324-9. PMID: 25702324
citations.BibTeX: @article{25702324, title={Incidence and risk factors of postpericardiotomy syndrome requiring medical attention: The Finland postpericardiotomy syndrome study.}, author={Lehto J and Gunn J and Karjalainen P and Airaksinen J and Kiviniemi T}, journal={J Thorac Cardiovasc Surg}, volume={149}, number={5}, pages={1324-9}}
